metadata.Title: CVE-2017-16927 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: The scp_v0s_accept function in sesman/libscp/libscp_v0.c in the session manager in xrdp through 0.9.4 uses an untrusted integer as a write length, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (buffer overflow and application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted input stream. It was discovered that xrdp could be made to overflow a buffer and crash.

criterions.comment: xrdp: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
